A Song<S>7892</S> of degrees<S>4609</S>. I will lift up<S>5375</S> mine eyes<S>5869</S> unto the hills<S>2022</S>, from whence<S>370</S> cometh<S>935</S> my help<S>5828</S>. <sup>I will: or, Shall I lift up mine eyes to the hills? whence should my help come?</sup>
My help<S>5828</S> cometh from the LORD<S>3068</S>, which made<S>6213</S> heaven<S>8064</S> and earth<S>776</S>.
He will not suffer<S>5414</S> thy foot<S>7272</S> to be moved<S>4132</S>: he that keepeth<S>8104</S> thee will not slumber<S>5123</S>.
Behold, he that keepeth<S>8104</S> Israel<S>3478</S> shall neither slumber<S>5123</S> nor sleep<S>3462</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> is thy keeper<S>8104</S>: the LORD<S>3068</S> is thy shade<S>6738</S> upon thy right<S>3225</S> hand<S>3027</S>.
The sun<S>8121</S> shall not smite<S>5221</S> thee by day<S>3119</S>, nor the moon<S>3394</S> by night<S>3915</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall preserve<S>8104</S> thee from all evil<S>7451</S>: he shall preserve<S>8104</S> thy soul<S>5315</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall preserve<S>8104</S> thy going out<S>3318</S> and thy coming in<S>935</S> from this time forth, and even for<S>5704</S> evermore<S>5769</S>.
